That's a great idea! Asking the studio if they know of any local sculptors who might be willing to mentor you or offer private lessons is a fantastic way to learn from experienced artists and gain a deeper understanding of their process and techniques.

Many sculptors, especially those who are passionate about their craft, enjoy sharing their knowledge and experience with others. Having a mentor or taking private lessons can provide you with:

* Personalized guidance and feedback on your work
* Insights into the sculptor's creative process and techniques
* Hands-on experience with different materials and tools
* Opportunities to learn from their mistakes and successes
* A chance to build a network of connections within the local art community

When asking the studio about potential mentors or private lessons, be prepared to discuss:

* Your goals and what you hope to achieve through mentorship or private lessons
* Your current level of experience and skillset
* What specific areas of sculpture you're interested in learning more about (e.g., abstract, figurative, materials, etc.)
* Your availability and schedule for lessons or mentorship

The studio may be able to connect you with a local sculptor who:

* Offers private lessons or workshops
* Is willing to mentor you in their studio or through regular meetings
* Can provide guidance on specific projects or techniques
* Can introduce you to other local artists and resources

Some potential questions to ask the studio include:

* Do you know of any local sculptors who offer private lessons or mentorship programs?
* Are there any sculptors in the studio's network who might be interested in mentoring or teaching private lessons?
* Can you recommend any local artists who specialize in [specific area of interest, e.g., abstract sculpture, figurative sculpture, etc.]?
* Are there any upcoming workshops or classes that might be a good fit for me?

Remember to be respectful of the sculptor's time and expertise, and be clear about your goals and expectations. With the right mentor or private lessons, you can gain valuable insights and skills to take your sculpting to the next level!
